alert.note: Alert for Kanawha; Lincoln; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kanawha, southern Putnam and northeastern Lincoln Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 626 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over St. Albans, or near Nitro, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Hurricane, Sissonville, Poca, Cross Lanes, Alum Creek, Institute, Tornado, Teays Valley, Culloden, Sweetland and Sod. This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 100 and 101, and between mile markers 104 and 115. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 33 and 57. Route 119 between mile markers 64 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
